forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 51. Southwest wind around 8 mph.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny. High near 60, with temperatures falling to around 58 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 7 to 12 mph.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, a gauzy veil of cloud blankets the city, hinting at the low and cool embrace of this early morning. With temperatures resting at a mild fifty-one degrees, the air holds a crispness that suggests layering is paramount for the day ahead. The forecast prophesies a gradual unveiling as sunlight filters through, promising a transition to partly sunny skies by mid-morning. Afternoon highs will hover near sixty, a comfortable warmth tempered by an omnipresent ocean breeze cascading from the southwest at a gentle pace of eight to twelve miles per hour.

Although the clouds provide a cozy ambiance, whispers of fog cling close to the coastal lines, infusing the air with a hint of mystery typical for this time of year. The marine layer, in its serpentine manner, weaves through the landscape, particularly around the iconic Golden Gate, creating a picturesque backdrop that begs for exploration. Dress in layers to navigate the temperature shifts—from a light sweater in the morning chill to a shirt for the midday warmth. Whether it's a stroll along the Embarcadero or a leisurely sit at a local café with a view of the bay, today invites a subtle intimacy with the city. A walk among the mural-lined streets or a casual visit to a gallery could enrich one’s day, allowing a connection with the pulse of urban life, softly reverberating beneath the ever-watchful fog.
